page.title: 18A farm in Conisbrough
page.content: Hill Top farm dates from the 19th. century. Many of the original buildings are now derelict. Of eight buildings only two are used. Most of the buildings and walls are made of limestone, quarried on the farm itself. There was intended to be 500acres of fields, but now there are only 220 acres making 25 fields, allcontaining crops. There have been many changes during the last twenty years. Much more mmachinery is now in use. Whilst farms have got smaller, tractors and ploughs have got bigger. Ther is almost apiece of machinery for every farm job. Twenty years ago the farm had servants and seven hands to work on the land. Now there are no servants and only two people are responsible for all the farm work. In good weather the farmer could work from 9.00am until 9.00pm.
